author: Special Correspondent
text:
Gnaneswari , a book by L.C. Ganapathy, was released at Chinmaya Mission in Srirangam on Friday. Sri Shridharananda, Regional Head of the Chinmaya Mission, released the first copy.

The book in Tamil, gives a detailed account of the interpretation of Sri Bhagavad Gita as explained by Sri Sant Gnaneswar Maharaj.

Mr. Ganapathy said the book had been written to benefit the mankind above caste, creed or colour-based differences.

Sri Bhagavad Gita has formulated certain principles (gnanam, bhakthi and karma yogam) and the book, in all simple terms, seeks to explain the vital clues for liberation through self-purification.

Mr. Ganapathy said the readers of the book would be able to realise the significance of principles of Gnaneswarar.

Pictures of spiritual leaders including acharyas Adi Sankara, Ramanuja, and Madhwa, and Sri Gnaneswarar have been incorporated in it.
title: Book on Gita released
